full_sentence: Do I have to point out the fact that the man who stabbed Henriette Reker, as well as the people setting "refugee" homes on fire are afraid that refugees will commit terrorist attacks and do not share our values? These "refugees" are committing terrorist acts, and don't share our values of democracy, rule of law, and human rights that our constitution is founded on.

So there was this black guy at my school who somehow got my phone number and kept sending me highly sexual messages. He would talk metaphors about race-mixing, and all the content was highly racial. I had to change my number, and I did not want to go to school. This happened 10 years ago but I still feel uncomfortable when I remember it. At least, it was good to a certain extent because even though by that time I wasn't even racially conscious, this shaped my aversion to black people for dating.

Huey Newton, co-founder and leader of the Black Panther Party, held a PhD from UC Santa Cruz. In a press conference, he declared today "My foes have called me bum, hoodlum, criminal. Some have even called me nigger. I imagine now they'll at least have to call me Dr. Nigger.".
